title: Conflicting rules 'no-confusing-arrow' and 'arrow-body-style'
body:
Currently I'm using `eslint` with the airbnb config to lint my project. However since the last update (6.0.1) i've found somewhat conflicting rules, the 'no-confusing-arrow' rule and the 'arrow-body-style' rule.

Take this piece of code:

``` js
export const conflict = (a) => a > 1 ? 'yes' : 'no';
```

This triggers the [`no-confusing-arrow`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-confusing-arrow) rule.

According to the rule it should be written as following:

``` js
export const conflict = (a) => {
  return a > 1 ? 'yes' : 'no';
};
```

However this triggers the [`arrow-body-style`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/arrow-body-style) rule.

Any idea how to solve this while keeping the shorthand if?

Versions used:

```
"eslint": "^2.2.0",
"eslint-config-airbnb": "^6.0.1",
```

title: npm@3 warn missing eslint-plugin-react a non react project
body:
Seems like eslint-plugin-react was moved to peer dependency, and now I'm getting

```
├── UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-react@^4.0.0
```

I'm using eslint-config-airbnb/base, for a non react project.

How can I get rid of this warning _without_ installing eslint-plugin-react?
Is there any plan for splitting /base to a separate package?

title: [rule links] reduce visual clutter proposal
`newline-per-chained-call` and PropTypes
How to allow `console.log()` in .eslint?
body:
How to allow `console.log()` in .eslint?
I tried

``` js
"rules": {
    "comma-dangle": 0,
    "no-console": 2
  }
```

but don't work.

title: how to use global variable (Meteor JS)?
Unable install eslint-config-airbnb due to semver.
body:
```
$ npm install eslint-config-airbnb
npm ERR! peerinvalid Peer eslint-config-airbnb@5.0.1 wants eslint-plugin-react@^3.16.1
```

My environment is:
- node: 4.3.1
- eslint: 2.2.0
- eslint-plugin-react: 4.0.0

title: npm i fails with 5.0.1 on eslint 2
body:
npm ERR! peerinvalid The package eslint@2.2.0 does not satisfy its siblings' peerDependencies requirements!
npm ERR! peerinvalid Peer eslint-config-airbnb@5.0.1 wants eslint@^1.0.0

My package:

```
    "eslint": "^2.0.0",
    "eslint-config-airbnb": "^5.0.1",
```

Switching to `"eslint": "^1.0.0"` in my package or in airbnb's package:

```
  "peerDependencies": {
    "eslint": "^2.0.0",
    "eslint-plugin-react": "^3.16.1"
  },
```

is fixing the problem.

Is it a plan to "support" eslint 2 ?

title: comma-dangle eslint error in legacy rules
body:
Hi!

In https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/tree/master/es5#commas you have note about trailing commas: `Additional trailing comma: Nope. This can cause problems with IE6/7 and IE9 if it's in quirksmode. Also, in some implementations of ES3 would add length to an array if it had an additional trailing comma`

But comma-dangle rule is presented in airbnb/legacy rule set.

What do you think about excluding this rule from airbnb/legacy?

title: eslint config needs to be updated to work with new version of eslint
body:
After upgrading to eslint 2.1, I'm seeing new errors for rules that have been deprecated, but are still being used in the Airbnb config:

```
   1:1   error  Rule 'no-empty-label' was removed and replaced by: no-labels                 no-empty-label
   1:1   error  Rule 'space-before-keywords' was removed and replaced by: keyword-spacing    space-before-keywords
   1:1   error  Rule 'space-after-keywords' was removed and replaced by: keyword-spacing     space-after-keywords
   1:1   error  Rule 'space-return-throw-case' was removed and replaced by: keyword-spacing  space-return-throw-case
```

Here are the places that those rules are being used:

```
$ grep -r no-empty-label node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/
node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/best-practices.js:    'no-empty-label': 2,

$ grep -r space-before-keywords node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/
node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/CHANGELOG.md: - enable `space-before-keywords` (#554)
node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/style.js:    'space-before-keywords': [2, 'always'],

$ grep -r space-after-keywords node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/
node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/style.js:    'space-after-keywords': [2, 'always'],

$ grep -r space-return-throw-case node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/
node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/style.js:    'space-return-throw-case': 2,
```

title: Getting warning about eslint not being installed, but it's installed
body:
I have these lines in my package.json:

```
    "eslint": "^2.1.0",
    "eslint-config-airbnb": "^5.0.1",
```

And I see this when running `npm install`:

`npm WARN eslint-config-airbnb@5.0.1 requires a peer of eslint@^1.0.0 but none was installed.`

However, eslint is definitely installed:

```
$ npm info eslint version
2.1.0

$ ./node_modules/eslint/bin/eslint.js --version
v2.1.0
```

Anyone know what's going on here?

title: Support eslint2
body:
Some rules were changed.

I think we must make new version.

title: Remove peer-dependency from eslint-config-airbnb
body:
Can I suggest a small change to eslint-config-airbnb to remove the peerDependency on eslint? The reasoning behind this is:
- Some plugins like gulp-eslint compartmentalise the eslint dependency, but with the package-level peerDependency it means that we end up getting an NPM warning at the root package that nobody can do anything about.
- Other packages may want to read/leverage the rule sets, and shouldn't have to take the NPM warning to do so.

Its kind of implicit that the plugin requires _something_ that leverages the eslint ruleset standard, so I'm not sure that an explicit peerDependency is actually a requirement anyay.

title: ESLint 2.0.0 Released -- New Rules to Consider
body:
To quote the [blog post](http://eslint.org/blog/2016/02/eslint-v2.0.0-released):

>  There are several new rules for this release:
> - [`array-callback-return`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/array-callback-return)
> - [`id-blacklist`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/id-blacklist)
> - [`keyword-spacing`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/keyword-spacing)
> - [`newline-per-chained-call`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/newline-per-chained-call)
> - [`no-confusing-arrow`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-confusing-arrow)
> - [`no-empty-function`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-empty-function)
> - [`no-extra-label`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-extra-label)
> - [`no-implicit-globals`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-implicit-globals)
> - [`no-new-symbol`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-new-symbol)
> - [`no-restricted-imports`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-restricted-imports)
> - [`no-self-assign`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-self-assign)
> - [`no-unmodified-loop-condition`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-unmodified-loop-condition)
> - [`no-unused-labels`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-unused-labels)
> - [`no-useless-constructor`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-useless-constructor)
> - [`no-whitespace-before-property`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-whitespace-before-property)
> - [`one-var-declaration-per-line`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/one-var-declaration-per-line)
> - [`prefer-rest-params`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/prefer-rest-params)
> - [`sort-imports`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/sort-imports)
> - [`template-curly-spacing`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/template-curly-spacing)
> - [`yield-star-spacing`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/yield-star-spacing)

title: Update to eslint 2.0
body:
ESLint 2.0 has been officially released and introduced some breaking changes. Any plans to support 2.0?

http://eslint.org/docs/user-guide/migrating-to-2.0.0

title: ESLint Rules not compatible with ESLint 2.0.0
body:
ESList just released 2.0.0, which has some breaking changes. This is probably not a complete list:

```
Rule 'no-empty-label' was removed and replaced by: no-labels
Rule 'space-return-throw-case' was removed and replaced by: keyword-spacing
Rule 'space-before-keywords' was removed and replaced by: keyword-spacing
Rule 'space-after-keywords' was removed and replaced by: keyword-spacing
```

```
  1:1  error  Rule 'space-after-keywords' was removed and replaced by: keyword-spacing     space-after-keywords
  1:1  error  Rule 'space-return-throw-case' was removed and replaced by: keyword-spacing  space-return-throw-case
```
